author: simel
title: Supply chains for industry 5.0
description: Le commerce mondial d'aujourd'hui est complexe et coûteux. Une coordination efficace, la sécurité et des données fiables sont nécessaires à leur bon fonctionnement.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is vague and not specific enough. I don't think just connecting companies and institutions to the Cardano Blockchain is going to solve supply chain operations.
f6_assessments.q1: I couldn't find a GitHub repository or any social profiles of the team in the proposal, and the website is new and contains nothing that shows relevant experience. Please consider adding team portfolios or code reps.
f6_assessments.q2: No timeline or short term goals are presented. I think this proposal will be hard to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal's solution idea for a supply chain tracking dapp is addressing the challenge but this proposal, as community members in the comments mentioned is not complete without a Roadmap, KPI's or technical documentation covering functional/technical components of the supply chain solution they're building.
f6_assessments.q1: The tangible information on specifics ofd previous work in this field is not included (beyond the relevant experience section). The team also does not include a timeline, KPI, or link to a technical doc/whitepaper (website does not include these key pieces of information either).
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided is not sufficient to audit the proposal success, a roadmap, KPI section, more detailed relevant exp section and a technical doc explaining how the protocol will operate in future is critical to auditing progress.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem is within the challenge, but the proposal doesn't have basic things for assessing the impact: 
- Explanation about how it will add value to Cardano ecosystem, this help convince CA/ vCA and voter to easily clear the impact of the project on the ecosystem
- Key metrics that align with the challenge setting, it will show how the project will affect the ecosystem by specific criteria.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal lacks all basic things for assessing the feasibility. Include: 
- Detailed roadmap to help CA/ vCA know milestones and summary things to do or finish at this time. 
- Detail implementation plan with a detailed explanation about features, actions, activities of their plan. This will help to assess all other parts in the proposal is suitable or not. 
- Detailed budget that should be pointed which/ who it will be used for. Based on the plan, it will be assessed reasonable or not to be funded and help voters make decisions on voting. 
Not just those info only, for more trust the proposal must have: 
- Team info with background or ability, and which roles they are working for in this proposal
- Some relevant risks and how the team will face them. To me, it helps to assess that the team has a well-preparation for their plan. 
And for getting the perfect score of feasibility, the proposal should attach some MVP, samples, evidence, resource... that the team is already done or on going doing it.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal doesn't have the basic things for auditing, including: 
- Roadmap with detail and realistic timeline. More detail will help Catalyst team easier on track and check the project regularly, currently, the project team has to report in biweek. 
- Key metrics that are clear and fittable with the plan and vision of the team, of course, must be aligned with the challenge setting. 
And 2 explanation to help Catalyst team easy understand what the proposal want to do: 
- Problem explanation, should be in case studies, context that the team has been aware and motivated to make the proposal.
- Solution explanation, to explain detail about how the solution can help to solve the problem.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal has nothing except some introduction about who they are and what they will do with the money. It has no impact on the Cardano ecosystem because they have no info to tell that what value their project adds to the Cardano ecosystem, and no info about key metrics to make sure that they are concerned about the challenge setting.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer showed nothing in this proposal for assessing its feasibility. Technically, with this project, he has to show a lot of detailed info about how this project will connect and manage to companies and institutions, coding the system... but instead, he asked for computer and website development. The proposer doesn't even have info about how the solution runs on Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer does provide not enough info that's sufficient to audit the progress and the success of this project. He has no roadmap and key metrics, that's the basic things for auditing the project. 
Moreover, because the content in the proposal is poorly - just about introduction the company. So I can't understand in detail the problem that the proposer wants to solve and solution can address it or not. Of course, there is no risk management that be included in this proposal also.

f6_assessments.q0:
Logistics and supply chain applications could indeed be very important areas Cardano could develop more going forward and could in theory have a very positive impact on the ecosystem as a whole. However in its current form, the proposal presents the broad topic that the team wishes to tackle in the future, but at this time no tangible solution is offered and no plan for an actual dapp is presented.
The impact on Cardano as a whole of what is currently planned would be minimal to non-existent.
The topic tackled by the team has very much potential for Cardano's future, thus I would suggest and hope that the team comes back with a well-written proposal, that includes all metrics and requirements for success in a future fund.
f6_assessments.q1:
The current scope of the proposal of buying a server and setting up a website for the company could probably be accomplished given the team's background.
But the question is why would that be something that the treasury would be interested in funding? There are no concrete plans of where these developments could lead in the future.
f6_assessments.q2:
The budget of the proposal is tentatively broken down, but no clear roadmap is presented, and no planned deployment date is mentioned. There isn't even a description of the dapp or services that would be ultimately deployed.
I would suggest a rethink and rewrite of the proposal to better inform the Cardano community of the team's vision, with clear KPIs a roadmap and definitions of success.

f6_assessments.q0: The use-case for this proposal is to use Cardano to bring trust and traceability into a supply chain. It aims a enabling faster and most cost efficient trades. This is a well-known use-case for blockchains, that would perfectly fit as such in the Dapps and Integration Challenge. However, the proposal does not include any details on how this would be developed, how success is defined and what are the steps to achieve it.
f6_assessments.q1:
Apart from the technical specs of the server, the technical blockchain based solution is not described at all. The team does not claim any computer science or software development experience and does not explain how these skills would be added to the team or hired. For this reason, I cannot confirm that the budget development estimation is appropriate.
I recommend for a further application to Catalyst Funding to develop the technical part, and if needed to partner with a team who has a complementary experience: what are the technical challenges to be taken? what are the expected functions for the software / platform?
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer website states that its platform development will not be opensource, so the community will not be able to look codes update to monitor software development progress.
No roadmap with milestones is presented, and the proposer does not list any KPIs that would enable to track the progress of the project. Even if the amount requested Is not high, I cannot tell that the community will be able to monitor the use of this funding. For a further application, please consider detailing to the community what eye will be given to look on the funded activity.

f6_assessments.q0: This crypto solution is currently in the limelight and has lots of potentials. This proposal could effectively improve the application of Cardano currency in the supply chain. The proposers plan to utilize the privacy and secured crypto transaction in the supply chain, which is highly adaptable. There are many companies with the same solution for other crypto currencies.
f6_assessments.q1: Although the proposal did not give a specific plan and method for utilizing crypto transactions, its clear and reasonable funding allocation and founders' experience in the supply chain sector can benefit the project's future success.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal contains very vague ideas about the solution. I do not see any significant competitive advantages that set the project apart. The website has more in-detail and in-length information, which is somewhat helpful for reviewers to get the idea of the project.

solution: SIMEL connecte les entreprises et les institutions au réseau blockchain de Cardano. Le résultat est un commerce meilleur, plus rapide et plus rentable.
experience: Forte de son expérience dans le secteur de la logistique internationale, notre petite équipe est composée de quatre professionnels répartis dans différents pays.
